chapter.title: Introduction and Motivation
chapter.para: SideKick is missing a very important language support: C++ structure browsing.

In order to parse C++, we need to be both smart and dumb. For example, it would be nice to be able to implicitly ignore all file not found errors, and undefined symbols, since we only need to provide a general structure tree of the elements.

chapter.title: Features
chapter.para: None of these features work yet, but this is what we want.

listitem.para: A project-viewer aware context, for storing INCLUDEPATH information (needed for most of the parsers to work).
Combine the information of the header and cpp file into a single tree view, allowing the user to see declarations and corresponding definitions right next to each other in the tree.
